page.title: 10Something to see
page.content: A local point of interest is{"the {tank"}, named after its original function to supply a "head" of water for the local water supply.It has attracted many people over the years, from dog walkers to gangs of adolescents. It can be approached very easily from Revidge Road, with more effort uphill from halfway up Lammack Road or with effort and a possible element of danger, skirting the edge of Blackburn Golf Club and up and over tussocks of grass. Once there any effort is forgotten at the panorama spread below. In the centre of the concrete platform, is an observation table. Pray for dry weather, and with the engraved lines as a guide you may see Blackpool Tower or Ingleborough in the Yorkshire Dales. This is an altogether worthwhile afternoon outing!
